law.catch_line: Immunity from civil or criminal liability for good faith performance of duties.
law.text: Anyone acting upon reasonable cause in the making of any report or investigation pursuant to this chapter, including representatives of the cabinet in the reasonable performance of their duties in good faith, and within the scope of their authority, shall have immunity from any civil or criminal liability that might otherwise be incurred or imposed. Any such participant shall have the same immunity with respect to participation in any judicial proceeding resulting from such report or investigation and such immunity shall apply to those who render protective services in good faith pursuant to the consent of the adult.
law.history: Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 132, sec. 24, effective June 20, 2005.
